intro: Capsella tenera, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or mouse-ear cress, is a small flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many familiar edible and ornamental plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features lobed, hairy leaves that resemble mouse ears. Its small white or yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom from spring to summer. Capsella tenera is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
